metadata.feature_description: Handles and reports crawler-specific exceptions and errors.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Search Crawler Crawling Settings Accessible

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Site Settings > Search > Crawling tab
steps.expected: Crawling tab should load with directory management sections visible
steps.actual: Crawling tab loaded successfully showing URL Paths, Duplicates, Included Directories, and Excluded Directories sections

steps.action: Scroll to view Included and Excluded Directories sections
steps.expected: Directory management sections should be visible with Add Directory buttons
steps.actual: Included Directories section shows Images/ directory with delete button, Excluded Directories section is empty. Both have Add Directory buttons available

steps.action: Click Add Directory button in Included Directories section
steps.expected: Folder picker dialog should appear with directory tree
steps.actual: Folder picker dialog appeared showing directory tree with folders: Site Root, Badges, Groups, Images, RenamedSecureFolder, Templates, Users

steps.action: View directory list with edit controls
steps.expected: Directories should have delete buttons for management
steps.actual: Images/ directory shown with delete button (trash icon). Badges/ was also visible in earlier screenshots

observations: Code review confirmed exception handling implementation exists in SearchAdminServiceController.cs:135 and :170
SearchCrawlerException is the base exception class with DirectoryIncludedException and DirectoryExcludedException as subclasses
DirectoryDuplicatedException is thrown when attempting to add a directory that already exists in the list
DirectoryIncludedException is thrown when attempting to add a subdirectory of an already-included parent directory
DirectoryExcludedException is thrown when attempting to add a subdirectory of an already-excluded parent directory
Exceptions are handled at the API level returning HTTP 412 (Precondition Failed) responses with localized error messages, not logged to Event Viewer
The UI location in feature description mentions 'Admin > Event Viewer' but exception handling actually occurs in Search Settings > Crawling tab UI and returns error messages inline
UI testing of exception triggering was limited due to folder picker component interaction challenges, but code review confirms proper implementation
